MAN.TITLE: grayplot_properties
MAN.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: description of the grayplot entities properties
MAN.DESCRIPTION:
The Grayplot entity is a leaf of the graphics entities hierarchy. It represents 2D plots of surface using colors and images (see grayplot, Matplot and Matplot1).
This field contains the visible property value for the entity . It's value should be "on" or "off" . If "on" the plot is drawn, If "off" the plot is not drawn on the screen.
This filed is not yet available.
This field contains the clip_state property value for the polyline. It's value should be :
"off" this means that the plot is not clipped
"cliprf" this means that the plot is clipped outside the Axes rectangle.
"on" this means that the plot is clipped outside the rectangle given by property clip_box.
This field contains the clip_box property. It's value should be an empty matrix if clip_state is "off" or the vector [x,y,w,h] (upper-left point width height)
If this property value is "scaled" the indices of painting colors are proportional to the value z coordinates. If this property value is "direct" and if the plot is a grayplot, the indices of painting colors are given by the data.
